books.title: A Voyage to Arcturus
books.author: David Lindsay
books.summary: One man’s journey through a psychedelic alien landscape of philosophy, religion, life, and death.

books.title: The Sea Hawk
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: A Cornish gentleman becomes a Barbary corsair and seeks vengeance on the jealous half brother who betrayed him.

books.title: “We”
books.author: Charles A. Lindbergh
books.summary: Legendary aviator Charles Lindbergh gives an account of his early life, how he got into flying, and his famous transatlantic flight.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Mystery at Lilac Inn
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective attempts to recover her friend’s stolen diamonds.

books.title: A Prefect’s Uncle
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s life at boarding school is disrupted by an uncle that he’s never met before.

books.title: The Winter’s Tale
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A king’s unfounded jealousy destroys his family and kingdom.

books.title: Fifty-One Tales
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A series of otherworldly short stories ranging from the moral to the whimsical.

books.title: World’s End
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: When the creator of the great city of Stirmingham dies, claimants vie to inherit control of his vast wealth, ensnaring two young lovers in a deadly plot.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: The Mystery at Lilac Inn
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective attempts to recover her friend’s stolen diamonds.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: A Voice from the South
books.author: Anna Julia Cooper
books.summary: A Black woman from the American South philosophizes on various subjects.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: A collection of occasional and dramatic poems by a Victorian poet, educator, and critic.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Leonid Andreyev
books.summary: A collection of Leonid Andreyev’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.
